metadata.title: CVE-2022-0171 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. The existing KVM SEV API has avulnerability that allows a non-root (host) user-level application to crashthe host kernel by creating a confidential guest VM instance in AMD CPUthat supports Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
